ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would not recommend it to another student, because I honestly did not learn very much.
I would definitely recommend this course to a fellow student as I felt like it was an enriching experience.

In this class, we addressed a wide variety of complex, provocative questions from a legal, psychological, and at times philosophical and moral perspective. Questions included: How should police respond to accusations of child abuse? Should adolescents who commit crimes be treated as adults? Are cochlear implants in children unethical? Should parents be able to choose the gender or sexual orientation of their child? Is childhood sexual abuse harmful? How should courts make custody decisions? I would definitely recommend this course to another psychology graduate student - and indeed, already have.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course enriched my knowledge of psychology by introducing both a developmental and a legal perspective. As a social psychologist, I am very interested in the real-world implications of my research, and this class expanded my understanding of what these implications might be.
